entities.description: "Kharkiv is a city in Ukraine where survivors find solace amidst war."
"The University of Strasbourg is an educational institution that experienced a takeover during World War II, shedding light on a dark period."
"New York is a location where a bill prohibiting the sale of pets in shops awaits the governor's decision."
"The University of Utah acknowledged missteps in its response to concerns about a student's death."
"Carleton Varney was a designer known as Mr. Color, trained by decorator Dorothy Draper, and had an aversion to the bland and beige; he was 85 years old."
"Jonas Vingegaard is a 25-year-old cyclist who won the Tour de France in only his second time riding cycling's most prestigious race."
"Apple is a big tech company seeking more viewers for its streaming services and competing for rights to broadcast games from sports leagues."
"Amazon is a big tech company seeking more viewers for its streaming services and competing for rights to broadcast games from sports leagues."
"The N.F.L. is a sports league whose broadcasting rights are being competed for by companies like Apple and Amazon."
"Depop is a social shopping app that became a springboard for young talent in the fashion world, with some of its most successful creators going into business for themselves."
"Meryl Streep is a fine actress, known for her use of eyewear in her performances."
"Mitch Smith is the author of the article discussing various topics including abortion measures, international news, national issues, obituaries, sports, business, opinion, and arts."
"INTERNATIONAL A4-11 is a section of the newspaper covering international news, specifically finding solace amid war in Kharkiv, Ukraine."
"NATIONAL A12-17, 20 is a section of the newspaper covering national news, including a bill on pet store sales and a student's death at the University of Utah."
"OBITUARIES D7-8 is a section of the newspaper dedicated to obituaries, including the death of designer Carleton Varney."
"SPORTS D1-6 is a section of the newspaper covering sports news, including women's basketball style and Jonas Vingegaard's win in the Tour de France."
"BUSINESS B1-6 is a section of the newspaper covering business news, including Big Tech's involvement in sports broadcasting and Gen Z designers on Depop."
"OPINION A18-19 is a section of the newspaper featuring opinion pieces, potentially including contributions from Charles M. Blow."
"ARTS C1-6 is a section of the newspaper covering arts and entertainment news, including an analysis of Meryl Streep's acting and her use of eyewear."
"Charles M. Blow is potentially an author or contributor to the OPINION A18-19 section of the newspaper."
"World War II is a historical event during which the University of Strasbourg was taken over, shedding light on a dark period in its history."
"No More Pet Store Puppies is a bill that prohibits the sale of dogs, cats, and rabbits in New York shops, awaiting the governor's decision."
"Examining a Student’s Death refers to the University of Utah's acknowledgment of missteps in its response to concerns about a student who was killed."
"Style, on the Court and Off is a topic in the SPORTS D1-6 section discussing how players in women’s basketball are styling themselves and how it's paying off for many."
"A Sudden Ascent to the Top is a story in the SPORTS D1-6 section about Jonas Vingegaard's unexpected win in the Tour de France."
"Big Tech Wants in the Game is a BUSINESS B1-6 section article discussing how companies like Apple and Amazon are competing for sports broadcasting rights."
"What She Sees in Glasses is an ARTS C1-6 section article analyzing what makes Meryl Streep a fine actress, possibly focusing on her use of eyewear."

entities.description: "The New York Times is a media organization that conducted an examination related to Mr. Solny's profiting from disputed buildings."

Beto O'Rourke, also known as Mr. O'Rourke, is a former congressman and the Democratic challenger in the race for governor against the incumbent Greg Abbott. He has raised $27.6 million in the last filing, outpacing Mr. Abbott.

Greg Abbott, also known as Mr. Abbott, is the current governor of Texas and a two-term incumbent. He is competing against Beto O'Rourke in the race for governor and has raised $24.9 million in the last filing.
"Texas is a state in the U.S. where significant events have influenced the race for governor and where abortion rights are being contested."

"Pastor Randy Frazee is a religious leader in Kansas City who supports giving legislators the power to restrict abortions."
"The Supreme Court's decision has focused energy on the abortion issue, particularly impacting Kansas."
"The overturning of Roe v. Wade by the Supreme Court has led to a significant shift in the abortion debate and the electoral test in Kansas."
"The Kansas Election is the first test of Americans' attitudes on abortion rights since the Supreme Court's decision to overturn Roe v. Wade."

"Courtney Schmitz is a volunteer at a campaign phone bank in Kansas City, expressing her outrage post the Supreme Court ruling."

"Republicans are a political party in Kansas where they outnumber Democrats and may gain authority to pass new abortion limits."
"Democrats are a political party in Kansas where they are outnumbered by Republicans, with the abortion debate impacting their stance."
"The State Constitution of Kansas is subject to an amendment vote that could remove protections of abortion rights."
